channel.title: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?
channel.description:
We've had a fair amount of topics over the years discussing the prospects of putting another skin on the forum, now I'm making this topic to seal the deal so we can understand what the community is interested in. Any themes that are suggested and discussed here would be optional themes (we are not open to changing the default theme) and shouldn't be anything stupid (like a pink pony theme, these posts will just be constituted as spam).
Please post your thoughts on whether we should have more themes, what those themes should be (link them etc), and show your support for other themes. This topic isn't to voice how you're an oracle and this isn't going to happen, any posts that void the concise point of the topic will again constitute as spam.

item.title: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

If you make something I can make a pull request on your behalf. I’m going to sort out an SQL file so users can setup the mopar forum files from github, I’ll stick it in this section later today.

Read full topic
item.source: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?

item.title: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

SilentCJ:

I would be more than happy to try out some themes or even design one myself, but as I said, I can’t get a personal fork of the forum actually running through my apache.

Part of the fun of helping the forum is spending ages setting it up in order to do work for free!

Read full topic
item.source: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?

item.title: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Tapatalk is proprietary and a pretty dumb idea actually, that’s what a browser is for. If someone wants to write or suggest a theme go for it, even better, submit a pull request.

And to extend on my post above, I’m not completely against the idea of the mobile theme, I just think the benefits to us (the consumers) are much greater with tapatalk.

I would be more than happy to try out some themes or even design one myself, but as I said, I can’t get a personal fork of the forum actually running through my apache.

Read full topic
item.source: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?

item.title: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:103, topic:539764”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=658607.msg4429370#msg4429370 date=1402493781]
Tapatalk is proprietary and a pretty dumb idea actually, that’s what a browser is for. If someone wants to write or suggest a theme go for it, even better, submit a pull request.
[/quote]
It’s convenient, using a browser in general on a mobile is still pretty clunky and slow, regardless of hardware, tapatalk simplifies it into a very usable (and familiar for those that use it already) interface.
ps. you haven’t responded to my pull request in regards to actually setting the forum up.

I don’t browse the forum on my mobile or any tablet device so do you have any suggestions? Would tapatalk fit the bill?

Definitely more than fit the bill, have you not had any experience with it at all?

As well as the interface, speed, usability, convenience advantages over a mobile browser/theme, it also offered push notifications for subscribed topics, personal messages, etc.[/quote]

Not to mention we’d be using a massively tested, updated, maintained application instead of getting forum members to cobble some shit together and hope it gets mainained

Read full topic
item.source: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?

item.title: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Tapatalk is proprietary and a pretty dumb idea actually, that’s what a browser is for. If someone wants to write or suggest a theme go for it, even better, submit a pull request.

It’s convenient, using a browser in general on a mobile is still pretty clunky and slow, regardless of hardware, tapatalk simplifies it into a very usable (and familiar for those that use it already) interface.
ps. you haven’t responded to my pull request in regards to actually setting the forum up.

Tom:

I don’t browse the forum on my mobile or any tablet device so do you have any suggestions? Would tapatalk fit the bill?

Definitely more than fit the bill, have you not had any experience with it at all?

As well as the interface, speed, usability, convenience advantages over a mobile browser/theme, it also offers push notifications for subscribed topics, personal messages, etc. good luck getting those with a mobile theme

Read full topic
item.source: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?

item.title: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

It’s still happening, after a long wait I’ve been given a platform to do the changes myself. I’ll push them to my fork of the official repository and then moparisthebest will apply them promptly. As far as a new theme goes is there any conclusive community decision on which one you’d all like? I don’t really care that much for a new theme so I can almost guarantee you won’t like the one I pick myself.

There are a few other modifications that need installing first so the theme will probably come towards the end due to compatibility etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Community input: What do you think about a new forum theme?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

why can’t yall just leave it alone, its been fine for how many years? the forum is not growing leave it the way it is for those who have been here.

Yes but there’s nothing stop old members leaving the forum from getting bored of its dull look and new members won’t be to impressed.

Just keep your settings to the default theme if you’re not happy. The majority want themes anyway.

Read full topic
